name: opsgenie
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing opsgenie cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`opsgenie` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/opsgenie/terraform-provider-opsgenie).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing opsgenie cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/opsgenie/terraform-provider-opsgenie)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-opsgenie` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-opsgenie/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-opsgenie` repo](https://github.com/opsgenie/terraform-provider-opsgenie/issues).

conditions.description: Conditions applied to filter. This is a block, structure is documented below.

type.description: A filter type, supported types are: `match-all`, `match-any-condition`, `match-all-conditions`. Default: `match-all`

expectedValue.description: User defined value that will be compared with alert field according to the operation. Default: empty string

field.description: Specifies which alert field will be used in condition. Possible values are `message`, `alias`, `description`, `source`, `entity`, `tags`, `actions`, `details`, `extra-properties`, `responders`, `teams`, `priority`

key.description: If `field` is set as extra-properties, key could be used for key-value pair

not.description: Indicates behaviour of the given operation. Default: `false`

operation.description: It is the operation that will be executed for the given field and key. Possible operations are `matches`, `contains`, `starts-with`, `ends-with`, `equals`, `contains-key`, `contains-value`, `greater-than`, `less-than`, `is-empty`, `equals-ignore-whitespace`.

order.description: Order of the condition in conditions list

type.description: Type of responder. Acceptable values are: `user`, `team`, `escalation` or `schedule`

restriction.description: A definition of hourly definition applied daily, this has to be used with combination: type = `time-of-day`. This is a block, structure is documented below.

restrictionList.description: List of days and hours definitions for field type = `weekday-and-time-of-day`. This is a block, structure is documented below.

type.description: Defines if restriction should apply daily on given hours or on certain days and hours. Possible values are: `time-of-day`, `weekday-and-time-of-day`

endMin.description: Ending minute of restriction on defined `end_hour`

startMin.description: Staring minute of restriction on defined `start_hour`

endHour.description: Ending hour of restriction on defined `end_day`

endMin.description: Ending minute of restriction on defined `end_hour`

startHour.description: Starting hour of restriction on defined `start_day`

startMin.description: Staring minute of restriction on defined `start_hour`

type.description: The responder type.
The responder type.

condition.description: The condition for notifying the recipient of escalation rule that is based on the alert state. Possible values are: `if-not-acked` and `if-not-closed`. Default: `if-not-acked`

delay.description: Time delay of the escalation rule, in minutes.

notifyType.description: Recipient calculation logic for schedules. Possible values are:

recipients.description: Object of schedule, team, or users which will be notified in escalation. The possible values for participants are: `user`, `schedule`, `team`. There can only be one recipient per each `rules`.

id.description: The ID of the Opsgenie Escalation.

description.description: Description that is generally used to provide a detailed information about the alert. This field must not be longer than 15000 characters.

enable.description: Option to enable stakeholder notifications.Default value is true.

message.description: Message that is to be passed to audience that is generally used to provide a content information about the alert.

alias.description: An identifier that is used for alert deduplication. Default: `{{alias}}`.

filters.description:
Used to specify rules for matching alerts and the filter type. Please note that depending on the integration type the field names in the filter conditions are:
* For SNS integration: `actions`, `alias`, `entity`, `Message`, `recipients`, `responders`, `Subject`, `tags`, `teams`, `eventType`, `Timestamp`, `TopicArn`.
* For API integration: `message`, `alias`, `description`, `source`, `entity`, `tags`, `actions`, `details`, `extra-properties`, `recipients`, `teams`, `priority`, `eventType`.
* For Email integration: `from_address`, `from_name`, `conversationSubject`, `subject`

type.description: The responder type - can be `escalation`, `team` or `user`.

ignoreTeamsFromPayload.description: If enabled, the integration will ignore teams sent in request payloads.

entities.description: This field represents the entity that maintenance will be applied. Entity field takes two mandatory fields as id and type.

state.description: State of rule that will be defined in maintenance and can take either enabled or disabled for policy type rules. This field has to be disabled for integration type entity rules.

id.description: The id of the entity that maintenance will be applied.

type.description: The type of the entity that maintenance will be applied. It can be either integration or policy.

endDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00).

startDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00).

type.description: The type of the entity that maintenance will be applied. It can be either integration or policy.

durations.description: Duration of this action. This is a block, structure is documented below.

timeAmount.description: A amount of time in `time_units`. This is a integer attribute.

maxRepeatCount.description: How many times to repeat. This is a integer attribute.

durations.description: Duration of this action (only required for "frequency-based" de-duplication action). This is a block, structure is documented below.

timeAmount.description: A amount of time in `time_units`. This is a integer attribute.

delayOption.description: Defines until what day to delay or for what duration. Possible values are: `for-duration`, `next-time`, `next-weekday`, `next-monday`, `next-tuesday`, `next-wednesday`, `next-thursday`, `next-friday`, `next-saturday`, `next-sunday`

durations.description: Duration of this action. If `delay_option` = `for-duration` this has to be set. This is a block, structure is documented below.

untilHour.description: Until what hour notifications will be delayed. If `delay_option` is set to antyhing else then `for-duration` this has to be set.

untilMinute.description: Until what minute on `until_hour` notifications will be delayed. If `delay_option` is set to antyhing else then `for-duration` this has to be set.

timeAmount.description: A amount of time in `time_units`. This is a integer attribute.

contacts.description: Defines the contact that notification will be sent to. This is a block, structure is documented below.

enabled.description: Defined if this step is enabled. Default: `true`

sendAfter.description: Time period, in minutes, notification will be sent after.

to.description: Address of a given method (eg. email address for `email`, phone number for `sms`/`voice` or mobile application name for `mobile`)

type.description: Kind of matching filter. Possible values: `match-all`, `match-any-condition`, `match-all-conditions`
The responder type.

restriction.description: It is a restriction object which is described below. In this case startDay/endDay fields are not supported. This can be used only if time restriction type is `time-of-day`.

restrictionList.description: It is a restriction object which is described below. This can be used only if time restriction type is `weekday-and-time-of-day`.

type.description: This parameter should be set to `time-of-day` or `weekday-and-time-of-day`.

endHour.description: Value of the hour that frame will end.

endMin.description: Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

startHour.description: Value of the hour that frame will start.

startMin.description: Value of the minute that frame will start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

endDay.description: Value of the day that frame will end.

endHour.description: Value of the hour that frame will end.

endMin.description:
Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

Both `start_day` and `end_day` can assume only `monday`, `tuesday`, `wednesday`, `thursday`, `friday`, `saturday`, or `sunday` values.

startDay.description: Value of the day that frame will start.

startHour.description: Value of the hour that frame will start

startMin.description: Value of the minute that frame will start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

priority.description: Priority level of the alert. Possible values are `P1`, `P2`, `P3`, `P4` and `P5`

message.description: Message that is to be passed to audience that is generally used to provide a content information about the alert.

role.description: The role for the user within the Team - can be either `admin` or `user`. Default: `user`.

id.description: The ID of the Opsgenie Escalation.
The ID of the Opsgenie Team.

provider.description:
The provider type for the opsgenie package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

actions.description: Actions to add to the alerts original actions value as a list of strings. If `ignore_original_actions` field is set to `true`, this will replace the original actions.

alertDescription.description: Description of the alert. You can use `{{description}}` to refer to the original alert description. Default: `{{description}}`

alias.description: Alias of the alert. You can use `{{alias}}` to refer to the original alias. Default: `{{alias}}`

continuePolicy.description: It will trigger other modify policies if set to `true`. Default: `false`

enabled.description: If policy should be enabled. Default: `true`

entity.description: Entity field of the alert. You can use `{{entity}}` to refer to the original entity. Default: `{{entity}}`

filters.description: A alert filter which will be applied. This filter can be empty: `filter {}` - this means `match-all`. This is a block, structure is documented below.

ignoreOriginalActions.description: If set to `true`, policy will ignore the original actions of the alert. Default: `false`

ignoreOriginalDetails.description: If set to `true`, policy will ignore the original details of the alert. Default: `false`

ignoreOriginalResponders.description: If set to `true`, policy will ignore the original responders of the alert. Default: `false`

ignoreOriginalTags.description: If set to `true`, policy will ignore the original tags of the alert. Default: `false`

policyDescription.description: Description of the policy. This can be max 512 characters.

priority.description: Priority of the alert. Should be one of `P1`, `P2`, `P3`, `P4`, or `P5`

responders.description: Responders to add to the alerts original responders value as a list of teams, users or the reserved word none or all. If `ignore_original_responders` field is set to `true`, this will replace the original responders. The possible values for responders are: `user`, `team`, `escalation`, `schedule`. tags.description: Tags to add to the alerts original tags value as a list of strings. If `ignore_original_responders` field is set to `true`, this will replace the original responders.

teamId.description: Id of team that this policy belongs to.

opsgenie:index/apiIntegration:ApiIntegra.description:
Manages an API Integration within Opsgenie.

## Import

API Integrations can be imported using the `integration_id`, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import opsgenie:index/apiIntegration:ApiIntegration this integration_id`
```

allowWriteAccess.description: This parameter is for configuring the write access of integration. If write access is restricted, the integration will not be authorized to write within any domain. Default: `true`.

apiKey.description: (Computed) API key of the created integration

enabled.description: This parameter is for specifying whether the integration will be enabled or not. Default: `true`

ignoreRespondersFromPayload.description: If enabled, the integration will ignore recipients sent in request payloads. Default: `false`.

name.description: Name of the integration. Name must be unique for each integration.

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team id of the integration. If changed, this will recreate a new API integration, which will probably have a different API key.

responders.description: User, schedule, teams or escalation names to calculate which users will receive the notifications of the alert.

suppressNotifications.description: If enabled, notifications that come from alerts will be suppressed. Default: `false`.

type.description: Type of the integration (API, Marid, Prometheus, etc). The full list of options can be found [here](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/integration-types-to-use-with-api).

webhookUrl.description: It is required if type is `Webhook`. This is the url Opsgenie will be sending request to.

allowWriteAccess.description: This parameter is for configuring the write access of integration. If write access is restricted, the integration will not be authorized to write within any domain. Default: `true`.

enabled.description: This parameter is for specifying whether the integration will be enabled or not. Default: `true`

ignoreRespondersFromPayload.description: If enabled, the integration will ignore recipients sent in request payloads. Default: `false`.

name.description: Name of the integration. Name must be unique for each integration.

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team id of the integration. If changed, this will recreate a new API integration, which will probably have a different API key.

responders.description: User, schedule, teams or escalation names to calculate which users will receive the notifications of the alert.

suppressNotifications.description: If enabled, notifications that come from alerts will be suppressed. Default: `false`.

type.description: Type of the integration (API, Marid, Prometheus, etc). The full list of options can be found [here](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/integration-types-to-use-with-api).

webhookUrl.description: It is required if type is `Webhook`. This is the url Opsgenie will be sending request to.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ApiIntegration resources.

allowWriteAccess.description: This parameter is for configuring the write access of integration. If write access is restricted, the integration will not be authorized to write within any domain. Default: `true`.

apiKey.description: (Computed) API key of the created integration

enabled.description: This parameter is for specifying whether the integration will be enabled or not. Default: `true`

ignoreRespondersFromPayload.description: If enabled, the integration will ignore recipients sent in request payloads. Default: `false`.

name.description: Name of the integration. Name must be unique for each integration.

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team id of the integration. If changed, this will recreate a new API integration, which will probably have a different API key.

responders.description: User, schedule, teams or escalation names to calculate which users will receive the notifications of the alert.

suppressNotifications.description: If enabled, notifications that come from alerts will be suppressed. Default: `false`.

type.description: Type of the integration (API, Marid, Prometheus, etc). The full list of options can be found [here](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/integration-types-to-use-with-api).

webhookUrl.description: It is required if type is `Webhook`. This is the url Opsgenie will be sending request to.

disallowedRights.description: The rights this role cannot have. For allowed values please refer [User Right Prerequisites](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/custom-user-role-api#section-user-right-prerequisites)

extendedRole.description: The role from which this role has been derived. Allowed Values: "user", "observer", "stakeholder".

grantedRights.description: The rights granted to this role. For allowed values please refer [User Right Prerequisites](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/custom-user-role-api#section-user-right-prerequisites)

opsgenie:index/emailIntegration:EmailInt.description:
Manages an Email Integration within Opsgenie.

## Import

Email Integrations can be imported using the `id`, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import opsgenie:index/emailIntegration:EmailIntegration test id`
```

emailUsername.description: The username part of the email address. It must be unique for each integration.

enabled.description: A Member block as documented below.

ignoreRespondersFromPayload.description: If enabled, the integration will ignore recipients sent in request payloads. Default: `false`.

name.description: Name of the integration. Name must be unique for each integration.

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team id of the integration.

suppressNotifications.description: If enabled, notifications that come from alerts will be suppressed. Default: `false`.

alertMessage.description: Specifies the alert message for heartbeat expiration alert. If this is not provided, default alert message is "HeartbeatName is expired".

alertPriority.description: Specifies the alert priority for heartbeat expiration alert. If this is not provided, default priority is P3.

alertTags.description: Specifies the alert tags for heartbeat expiration alert.

description.description: An optional description of the heartbeat

enabled.description: Enable/disable heartbeat monitoring.

interval.description: Specifies how often a heartbeat message should be expected.

intervalUnit.description: Interval specified as minutes, hours or days.

description.description: Description that is generally used to provide a detailed information about the alert. This field must not be longer than 15000 characters.

details.description: Map of key-value pairs to use as custom properties of the incident template. This field must not be longer than 8000 characters.

message.description: Message that is to be passed to audience that is generally used to provide a content information about the alert.

opsgenie:index/integrationAction:Integra.description:
Manages advanced actions for Integrations within Opsgenie. This applies for the following resources:
* `opsgenie.ApiIntegration`
* `opsgenie.EmailIntegration`

The actions that are supported are:
* `create`
* `close`
* `acknowledge`
* `add_note`
* `ignore`

integrationId.description: ID of the parent integration resource to bind to.
ID of the parent integration resource to bind to.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering IntegrationAction resources.

integrationId.description: ID of the parent integration resource to bind to.

opsgenie:index/maintenance:Maintenance.description:
Manages a Maintenance within Opsgenie.

## Import

Maintenance policies can be imported using the `policy_id`, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import opsgenie:index/maintenance:Maintenance test policy_id`
```

description.description: Description for the maintenance.

rules.description: Rules of maintenance, which takes a list of rule objects and defines the maintenance rules over integrations and policies.

times.description: Time configuration of maintenance. It takes a time object which has type, startDate and endDate fields

description.description: Description for the maintenance.

rules.description: Rules of maintenance, which takes a list of rule objects and defines the maintenance rules over integrations and policies.

times.description: Time configuration of maintenance. It takes a time object which has type, startDate and endDate fields

autoCloseActions.description: Auto Restart Action of the policy. This is a block, structure is documented below.

autoRestartActions.description: Auto Restart Action of the policy. This is a block, structure is documented below.

deDuplicationActions.description: Deduplication Action of the policy. This is a block, structure is documented below.

delayActions.description: Delay notifications. This is a block, structure is documented below.

filters.description: A notification filter which will be applied. This filter can be empty: `filter {}` - this means `match-all`. This is a block, structure is documented below.

policyDescription.description: Description of the policy. This can be max 512 characters.

suppress.description: Suppress value of the policy. Values are: `true`, `false`. Default: `false`

teamId.description: Id of team that this policy belons to.

timeRestrictions.description: Time restrictions specified in this field must be met for this policy to work. This is a block, structure is documented below.

suppress.description: Suppress value of the policy. Values are: `true`, `false`. Default: `false`

teamId.description: Id of team that this policy belons to.

timeRestrictions.description: Time restrictions specified in this field must be met for this policy to work. This is a block, structure is documented below.

actionType.description: Type of the action that notification rule will have. Allowed values: `create-alert`, `acknowledged-alert`, `closed-alert`, `assigned-alert`, `add-note`, `schedule-start`, `schedule-end`, `incoming-call-routing`

enabled.description: If policy should be enabled. Default: `true`

notificationTimes.description: List of Time Periods that notification for schedule start/end will be sent. Allowed values: `just-before`, `15-minutes-ago`, `1-hour-ago`, `1-day-ago`. If `action_type` is `schedule-start` or `schedule-end` then it is required.

order.description: Order of the condition in conditions list

username.description: Username of user to which this notification rule belongs to.

opsgenie:index/schedule:Schedule.description:
Manages a Schedule within Opsgenie.

## Import

Schedule can be imported using the `schedule_id`, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import opsgenie:index/schedule:Schedule test schedule_id`
```

description.description: The description of schedule.

enabled.description: Enable/disable state of schedule

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team id of the schedule.

timezone.description: Timezone of schedule. Please look at [Supported Timezone Ids](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/supported-timezone-ids) for available timezones - Default: `America/New_York`.

description.description: The description of schedule.

enabled.description: Enable/disable state of schedule

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team id of the schedule.

timezone.description: Timezone of schedule. Please look at [Supported Timezone Ids](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/supported-timezone-ids) for available timezones - Default: `America/New_York`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Schedule resources.

description.description: The description of schedule.

enabled.description: Enable/disable state of schedule

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team id of the schedule.

timezone.description: Timezone of schedule. Please look at [Supported Timezone Ids](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/supported-timezone-ids) for available timezones - Default: `America/New_York`.

endDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

length.description: Length of the rotation with default value 1.

participants.description: List of escalations, teams, users or the reserved word none which will be used in schedule. Each of them can be used multiple times and will be rotated in the order they given. "user,escalation,team,none"

startDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

type.description: Type of rotation. May be one of daily, weekly and hourly.

endDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

length.description: Length of the rotation with default value 1.

participants.description: List of escalations, teams, users or the reserved word none which will be used in schedule. Each of them can be used multiple times and will be rotated in the order they given. "user,escalation,team,none"

startDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

type.description: Type of rotation. May be one of daily, weekly and hourly.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ScheduleRotation resources.

endDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

length.description: Length of the rotation with default value 1.

participants.description: List of escalations, teams, users or the reserved word none which will be used in schedule. Each of them can be used multiple times and will be rotated in the order they given. "user,escalation,team,none"

startDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

type.description: Type of rotation. May be one of daily, weekly and hourly.

name.description: Name of the service. This field must not be longer than 100 characters.

tags.description: Tags for the service, with a maximum of 20 tags per service.

deleteDefaultResources.description: Set to true to remove default escalation and schedule for newly created team. **Be careful its also changes that team routing rule to None. That means you have to define routing rule as well**

description.description: A description for this team.

ignoreMembers.description: Set to true to ignore any configured member blocks and any team member added/updated/removed via OpsGenie web UI. Use this option e.g. to maintain membership via web UI only and use it only for new teams. Changing the value for existing teams might lead to strange behaviour. Default: `false`.

Use this option e.g. to maintain membership via web UI only and use it only for new teams. Changing the value for existing teams might lead to strange behaviour. Default: `false`.

teamId.description: Id of the team owning the routing rule

timeRestrictions.description: You can refer Time Restriction for detailed information about time restriction and its fields.

timezone.description: Timezone of team routing rule. If timezone field is not given, account timezone is used as default.You can refer to Supported Locale IDs for available timezones

enabled.description: Enable contact of the user in OpsGenie. Default value is true.

method.description: This parameter is the contact method of user and should be one of email, sms or voice. Please note that adding mobile is not supported from API.

to.description: to field is the address of given method.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getEscalation.

description.description: Escalation Description

ownerTeamId.description: If owner team exist the id of the team is exported

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getEscalation.

description.description: Escalation Description

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

ownerTeamId.description: If owner team exist the id of the team is exported

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getHeartbeat.

alertMessage.description: Specifies the alert message for heartbeat expiration alert. If this is not provided, default alert message is "HeartbeatName is expired".

alertPriority.description: Specifies the alert priority for heartbeat expiration alert. If this is not provided, default priority is P3.

alertTags.description: Specifies the alert tags for heartbeat expiration alert.

description.description: An optional description of the heartbeat

enabled.description: Enable/disable heartbeat monitoring.

interval.description: Specifies how often a heartbeat message should be expected.

intervalUnit.description: Interval specified as minutes, hours or days.

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team of the heartbeat.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getHeartbeat.

alertPriority.description: Specifies the alert priority for heartbeat expiration alert. If this is not provided, default priority is P3.

alertTags.description: Specifies the alert tags for heartbeat expiration alert.

description.description: An optional description of the heartbeat

enabled.description: Enable/disable heartbeat monitoring.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

interval.description: Specifies how often a heartbeat message should be expected.

intervalUnit.description: Interval specified as minutes, hours or days.

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team of the heartbeat.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getSchedule.

description.description: Timezone of schedule. Please look at [Supported Timezone Ids](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/supported-timezone-ids) for available timezones - Default: `America/New_York`.

enabled.description: Enable/disable state of schedule

ownerTeamId.description: Owner team id of the schedule.

enabled.description: Enable/disable state of schedule

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getService.

description.description: Description field of the service that is generally used to provide a detailed information about the service.

name.description:
Name of the service. This field must not be longer than 100 characters.

The following attributes are exported:

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getService.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTeam.

description.description: A description for this team.

members.description: A Member block as documented below.

name.description:
The name associated with this team. Opsgenie defines that this must not be longer than 100 characters.

The following attributes are exported:

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTeam.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUser.

fullName.description: The Full Name of the User.

locale.description: Location information for the user. Please look at [Supported Locale Ids](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/supported-locales) for available locales.

role.description: The Role assigned to the User. Either a built-in such as 'Owner', 'Admin' or 'User' - or the name of a custom role.

timezone.description: Timezone information of the user. Please look at [Supported Timezone Ids](https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/supported-timezone-ids) for available timezones.

username.description: The email address associated with this user. Opsgenie defines that this must not be longer than 100 characters.
